column4: I need some help: I can't get ubuntu connected to the internet
what kind of connection do you want to use?
ethernet
click on system administration networking and you should be able to do it from there
the problem is that ubuntu claims it has the ethernet card configured and connected, yet when I try to even ping the router I have it doesn't get ponged back
there is no machine between you and the firewall?
nope, only an ethernet cable
is there another machine on the network?
yes, this iBook I'm using now
and when I try to connect somewhere with ubuntu, even this machine's net connection freezes
I suggest that the router is not configured to give more than one IP seems like that
turn off the ibook - and reboot ubuntu see if gets network
hmm, thanks for the tip
unless you are comfortable with terminals
well, not comfortable - yet

if the router is only putting up one internal ip for use then you would typically see what you are seeing, if that is thae case it is a matter of logging into the router and allowing it to give out more ips
nope, that was not the case
and I remembered just that win98 works fine with the router
at the same time as the mac?
yes
let us first check the cable plug it into the mac - it should just work
yes the cable is working
